verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:1
verses.text: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Magnesians Shorter and Longer Versions  Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church blessed in the grace of God the Father, in Jesus Christ our Saviour, in whom I salute the Church which is at Magnesia, near the Maeander, and wish it abundance of happiness in God the Father, and in Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:2
verses.text: Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church blessed in the grace of God the Father, in Jesus Christ our Saviour, in whom I salute the Church which is at Magnesia, near the Maeander, and wish it abundance of happiness in God the Father, and in Jesus Christ, our Lord, in whom may you have abundance of happiness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:3
verses.text: Chapter 1 — Reason of writing the epistle.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:4
verses.text: Having been informed of your godly love, so well-ordered, I rejoiced greatly, and determined to commune with you in the faith of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:5
verses.text: For as one who has been thought worthy of the most honourable of all names, in those bonds which I bear about, I commend the Churches, in which I pray for a union both of the flesh and spirit of Jesus Christ, the constant source of our life, and of faith and love, to which nothing is to be preferred, but especially of Jesus and the Father, in whom, if we endure all the assaults of the prince of this world, and escape them, we shall enjoy God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:6
verses.text: Having been informed of your godly love, so well-ordered, I rejoiced greatly, and determined to commune with you in the faith of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 1:7
verses.text: For as one who has been thought worthy of a divine and desirable name, in those bonds which I bear about, I commend the Churches, in which I pray for a union both of the flesh and spirit of Jesus Christ, "who is the Saviour of all men, but specially of them that believe;" by whose blood ye were redeemed; by whom ye have known God, or rather have been known by Him; in whom enduring, ye shall escape all the assaults of this world: for "He is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that which ye are able".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 2:1
verses.text: Chapter 2 — I rejoice in your messengers.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 2:2
verses.text: Since, then, I have had the privilege of seeing you, through Damas your most worthy bishop, and through your worthy presbyters Bassus and Apollonius, and through my fellow-servant the deacon Sotio, whose friendship may I ever enjoy, inasmuch as he is subject to the bishop as to the grace of God, and to the presbytery as to the law of Jesus Christ, I now write to you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 2:3
verses.text: Since, then, I have had the privilege of seeing you, through Damas your most worthy bishop, and through your worthy presbyters Bassus and Apollonius, and through my fellow-servant the deacon Sotio, whose friendship may I ever enjoy, inasmuch as he, by the grace of God, is subject to the bishop and presbytery, in the law of Jesus Christ, I now write to you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:1
verses.text: Chapter 3 — Honour your youthful bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:2
verses.text: Now it becomes you also not to treat your bishop too familiarly on account of his youth, but to yield him all reverence, having respect to the power of God the Father, as I have known even holy presbyters do, not judging rashly, from the manifest youthful appearance of their bishop, but as being themselves prudent in God, submitting to him, or rather not to him, but to the Father of Jesus Christ, the bishop of us all.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:3
verses.text: It is therefore fitting that you should, after no hypocritical fashion, obey your bishop, in honour of Him who has willed us so to do, since he that does not so deceives not by such conduct the bishop that is visible, but seeks to mock Him that is invisible.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:4
verses.text: And all such conduct has reference not to man, but to God, who knows all secrets.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:5
verses.text: Now it becomes you also not to despise the age of your bishop, but to yield him all reverence, according to the will of God the Father, as I have known even holy presbyters do, not having regard to the manifest youth of their bishop, but to his knowledge in God; inasmuch as "not the ancient are necessarily wise, nor do the aged understand prudence; but there is a spirit in men".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:6
verses.text: For Daniel the wise, at twelve years of age, became possessed of the divine Spirit, and convicted the elders, who in vain carried their grey hairs, of being false accusers, and of lusting after the beauty of another man's wife.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:7
verses.text: Samuel also, when he was but a little child, reproved Eli, who was ninety years old, for giving honour to his sons rather than to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:8
verses.text: In like manner, Jeremiah also received this message from God, "Say not, I am a child".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:9
verses.text: Solomon too, and Josiah, exemplified the same thing.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:10
verses.text: The former, being made king at twelve years of age, gave that terrible and difficult judgment in the case of the two women concerning their children.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:11
verses.text: The latter, coming to the throne when eight years old cast down the altars and temples of the idols, and burned down the groves, for they were dedicated to demons, and not to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:12
verses.text: And he slew the false priests, as the corrupters and deceivers of men, and not the worshippers of the Deity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:13
verses.text: Wherefore youth is not to be despised when it is devoted to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:14
verses.text: But he is to be despised who is of a wicked mind, although he be old, and full of wicked days.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:15
verses.text: Timothy the Christ-bearer was young, but hear what his teacher writes to him: "Let no man despise thy youth, but be thou an example of the believers in word and in conduct".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:16
verses.text: It is becoming, therefore, that ye also should be obedient to your bishop, and contradict him in nothing; for it is a fearful thing to contradict any such person.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:17
verses.text: For no one does by such conduct deceive him that is visible, but does in reality seek to mock Him that is invisible, who, however, cannot be mocked by any one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:18
verses.text: And every such act has respect not to man, but to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:19
verses.text: For God says to Samuel, "They have not mocked thee, but Me".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:20
verses.text: And Moses declares, "For their murmuring is not against us, but against the Lord God".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:21
verses.text: No one of those has, in fact, remained unpunished, who rose up against their superiors.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:22
verses.text: For Dathan and Abiram did not speak against the law, but against Moses, and were cast down alive into Hades.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:23
verses.text: Korah also, and the two hundred and fifty who conspired with him against Aaron, were destroyed by fire.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:24
verses.text: Absalom, again, who had slain his brother, became suspended on a tree, and had his evil-designing heart thrust through with darts.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:25
verses.text: In like manner was Abeddadan beheaded for the same reason.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:26
verses.text: Uzziah, when he presumed to oppose the priests and the priesthood, was smitten with leprosy.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:27
verses.text: Saul also was dishonoured, because he did not wait for Samuel the high priest.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 3:28
verses.text: It behoves you, therefore, also to reverence your superiors.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:1
verses.text: Chapter 4 — Some wickedly act independently of the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:2
verses.text: It is fitting, then, not only to be called Christians, but to be so in reality: as some indeed give one the title of bishop, but do all things without him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:3
verses.text: Now such persons seem to me to be not possessed of a good conscience, seeing they are not stedfastly gathered together according to the commandment.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:4
verses.text: It is fitting, then, not only to be called Christians, but to be so in reality.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:5
verses.text: For it is not the being called so, but the being really so, that renders a man blessed.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 4:6
verses.text: To those who indeed talk of the bishop, but do all things without him, will He who is the true and first Bishop, and the only High Priest by nature, declare, "Why call ye Me Lord, and do not the things which I say?" For such persons seem to me not possessed of a good conscience, but to be simply dissemblers and hypocrites.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:1
verses.text: Chapter 5 — Death is the fate of all such.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:2
verses.text: Seeing, then, all things have an end, these two things are simultaneously set before us—death and life; and every one shall go unto his own place.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:3
verses.text: For as there are two kinds of coins, the one of God, the other of the world, and each of these has its special character stamped upon it, so is it also here.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:4
verses.text: The unbelieving are of this world; but the believing have, in love, the character of God the Father by Jesus Christ, by whom, if we are not in readiness to die into His passion, His life is not in us.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:5
verses.text: Seeing, then, all things have an end, and there is set before us life upon our observance of God's precepts, but death as the result of disobedience, and every one, according to the choice he makes, shall go to his own place, let us flee from death, and make choice of life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:6
verses.text: For I remark, that two different characters are found among men—the one true coin, the other spurious.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:7
verses.text: The truly devout man is the right kind of coin, stamped by God Himself.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:8
verses.text: The ungodly man, again, is false coin, unlawful, spurious, counterfeit, wrought not by God, but by the devil.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:9
verses.text: I do not mean to say that there are two different human natures, but that there is one humanity, sometimes belonging to God, and sometimes to the devil.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:10
verses.text: If any one is truly religious, he is a man of God; but if he is irreligious, he is a man of the devil, made such, not by nature, but by his own choice.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:11
verses.text: The unbelieving bear the image of the prince of wickedness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 5:12
verses.text: The believing possess the image of their Prince, God the Father, and Jesus Christ, through whom, if we are not in readiness to die for the truth into His passion, His life is not in us.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:1
verses.text: Chapter 6 — Preserve harmony.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:2
verses.text: Since therefore I have, in the persons before mentioned, beheld the whole multitude of you in faith and love, I exhort you to study to do all things with a divine harmony, while your bishop presides in the place of God, and your presbyters in the place of the assembly of the apostles, along with your deacons, who are most dear to me, and are entrusted with the ministry of Jesus Christ, who was with the Father before the beginning of time, and in the end was revealed.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:3
verses.text: Do ye all then, imitating the same divine conduct, pay respect to one another, and let no one look upon his neighbour after the flesh, but do ye continually love each other in Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:4
verses.text: Let nothing exist among you that may divide you; but be ye united with your bishop, and those that preside over you, as a type and evidence of your immortality.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:5
verses.text: Since therefore I have, in the persons before mentioned, beheld the whole multitude of you in faith and love, I exhort you to study to do all things with a divine harmony, while your bishop presides in the place of God, and your presbyters in the place of the assembly of the apostles, along with your deacons, who are most dear to me, and are entrusted with the ministry of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:6
verses.text: He, being begotten by the Father before the beginning of time, was God the Word, the only-begotten Son, and remains the same for ever; for "of His kingdom there shall be no end," says Daniel the prophet.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:7
verses.text: Let us all therefore love one another in harmony, and let no one look upon his neighbour according to the flesh, but in Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 6:8
verses.text: Let nothing exist among you which may divide you; but be ye united with your bishop, being through him subject to God in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:1
verses.text: Chapter 7 — Do nothing without the bishop and presbyters.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:2
verses.text: As therefore the Lord did nothing without the Father, being united to Him, neither by Himself nor by the apostles, so neither do ye anything without the bishop and presbyters.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:3
verses.text: Neither endeavour that anything appear reasonable and proper to yourselves apart; but being come together into the same place, let there be one prayer, one supplication, one mind, one hope, in love and in joy undefiled.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:4
verses.text: There is one Jesus Christ, than whom nothing is more excellent.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:5
verses.text: Do ye therefore all run together as into one temple of God, as to one altar, as to one Jesus Christ, who came forth from one Father, and is with and has gone to one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:6
verses.text: As therefore the Lord does nothing without the Father, for says He, "I can of mine own self do nothing," so do ye, neither presbyter, nor deacon, nor layman, do anything without the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:7
verses.text: Nor let anything appear commendable to you which is destitute of his approval.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:8
verses.text: For every such thing is sinful, and opposed to the will of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:9
verses.text: Do ye all come together into the same place for prayer.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:10
verses.text: Let there be one common supplication, one mind, one hope, with faith unblameable in Christ Jesus, than which nothing is more excellent.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 7:11
verses.text: Do ye all, as one man, run together into the temple of God, as unto one altar, to one Jesus Christ, the High Priest of the unbegotten God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:1
verses.text: Chapter 8 — Caution against false doctrines.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:2
verses.text: Be not deceived with strange doctrines, nor with old fables, which are unprofitable.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:3
verses.text: For if we still live according to the Jewish law, we acknowledge that we have not received grace.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:4
verses.text: For the divinest prophets lived according to Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:5
verses.text: On this account also they were persecuted, being inspired by His grace to fully convince the unbelieving that there is one God, who has manifested Himself by Jesus Christ His Son, who is His eternal Word, not proceeding forth from silence, and who in all things pleased Him that sent Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:6
verses.text: Be not deceived with strange doctrines, "nor give heed to fables and endless genealogies," and things in which the Jews make their boast.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:7
verses.text: "Old things are passed away: behold, all things have become new".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:8
verses.text: For if we still live according to the Jewish law, and the circumcision of the flesh, we deny that we have received grace.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:9
verses.text: For the divinest prophets lived according to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:10
verses.text: On this account also they were persecuted, being inspired by grace to fully convince the unbelieving that there is one God, the Almighty, who has manifested Himself by Jesus Christ His Son, who is His Word, not spoken, but essential.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 8:11
verses.text: For He is not the voice of an articulate utterance, but a substance begotten by divine power, who has in all things pleased Him that sent Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:1
verses.text: Chapter 9 — Let us live with Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:2
verses.text: If, therefore, those who were brought up in the ancient order of things have come to the possession of a new hope, no longer observing the Sabbath, but living in the observance of the Lord's Day, on which also our life has sprung up again by Him and by His death—whom some deny, by which mystery we have obtained faith, and therefore endure, that we may be found the disciples of Jesus Christ, our only Master—how shall we be able to live apart from Him, whose disciples the prophets themselves in the Spirit did wait for Him as their Teacher? And therefore He whom they rightly waited for, being come, raised them from the dead.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:3
verses.text: If, then, those who were conversant with the ancient Scriptures came to newness of hope, expecting the coming of Christ, as the Lord teaches us when He says, "If ye had believed Moses, ye would have believed Me, for he wrote of Me;" and again, "Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it, and was glad; for before Abraham was, I am;" how shall we be able to live without Him? The prophets were His servants, and foresaw Him by the Spirit, and waited for Him as their Teacher, and expected Him as their Lord and Saviour, saying, "He will come and save us".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:4
verses.text: Let us therefore no longer keep the Sabbath after the Jewish manner, and rejoice in days of idleness; for "he that does not work, let him not eat".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:5
verses.text: For say the holy oracles, "In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat thy bread".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:6
verses.text: But let every one of you keep the Sabbath after a spiritual manner, rejoicing in meditation on the law, not in relaxation of the body, admiring the workmanship of God, and not eating things prepared the day before, nor using lukewarm drinks, and walking within a prescribed space, nor finding delight in dancing and plaudits which have no sense in them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:7
verses.text: And after the observance of the Sabbath, let every friend of Christ keep the Lord's Day as a festival, the resurrection-day, the queen and chief of all the days of the week.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:8
verses.text: Looking forward to this, the prophet declared, "To the end, for the eighth day," on which our life both sprang up again, and the victory over death was obtained in Christ, whom the children of perdition, the enemies of the Saviour, deny, "whose god is their belly, who mind earthly things," who are "lovers of pleasure, and not lovers of God, having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 9:9
verses.text: These make merchandise of Christ, corrupting His word, and giving up Jesus to sale: they are corrupters of women, and covetous of other men's possessions, swallowing up wealth insatiably; from whom may ye be delivered by the mercy of God through our Lord Jesus Christ!.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:1
verses.text: Chapter 10 — Beware of Judaizing.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:2
verses.text: Let us not, therefore, be insensible to His kindness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:3
verses.text: For were He to reward us according to our works, we should cease to be.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:4
verses.text: Therefore, having become His disciples, let us learn to live according to the principles of Christianity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:5
verses.text: For whosoever is called by any other name besides this, is not of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:6
verses.text: Lay aside, therefore, the evil, the old, the sour leaven, and be ye changed into the new leaven, which is Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:7
verses.text: Be ye salted in Him, lest any one among you should be corrupted, since by your savour ye shall be convicted.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:8
verses.text: It is absurd to profess Christ Jesus, and to Judaize.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:9
verses.text: For Christianity did not embrace Judaism, but Judaism Christianity, that so every tongue which believeth might be gathered together to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:10
verses.text: Let us not, therefore, be insensible to His kindness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:11
verses.text: For were He to reward us according to our works, we should cease to be.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:12
verses.text: For "if Thou, Lord, shalt mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?" Let us therefore prove ourselves worthy of that name which we have received.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:13
verses.text: For whosoever is called by any other name besides this, he is not of God; for he has not received the prophecy which speaks thus concerning us: "The people shall be called by a new name, which the Lord shall name them, and shall be a holy people".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:14
verses.text: This was first fulfilled in Syria; for "the disciples were called Christians at Antioch," when Paul and Peter were laying the foundations of the Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:15
verses.text: Lay aside, therefore, the evil, the old, the corrupt leaven, and be ye changed into the new leaven of grace.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:16
verses.text: Abide in Christ, that the stranger may not have dominion over you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:17
verses.text: It is absurd to speak of Jesus Christ with the tongue, and to cherish in the mind a Judaism which has now come to an end.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:18
verses.text: For where there is Christianity there cannot be Judaism.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:19
verses.text: For Christ is one, in whom every nation that believes, and every tongue that confesses, is gathered unto God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 10:20
verses.text: And those that were of a stony heart have become the children of Abraham, the friend of God; and in his seed all those have been blessed who were ordained to eternal life in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:1
verses.text: Chapter 11 — I write these things to warn you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:2
verses.text: These things I address to you, my beloved, not that I know any of you to be in such a state; but, as less than any of you, I desire to guard you beforehand, that ye fall not upon the hooks of vain doctrine, but that ye attain to full assurance in regard to the birth, and passion, and resurrection which took place in the time of the government of Pontius Pilate, being truly and certainly accomplished by Jesus Christ, who is our hope, from which may no one of you ever be turned aside.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:3
verses.text: These things I address to you, my beloved, not that I know any of you to be in such a state; but, as less than any of you, I desire to guard you beforehand, that ye fall not upon the hooks of vain doctrine, but that you may rather attain to a full assurance in Christ, who was begotten by the Father before all ages, but was afterwards born of the Virgin Mary without any intercourse with man.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:4
verses.text: He also lived a holy life, and healed every kind of sickness and disease among the people, and wrought signs and wonders for the benefit of men; and to those who had fallen into the error of polytheism He made known the one and only true God, His Father, and underwent the passion, and endured the cross at the hands of the Christ-killing Jews, under Pontius Pilate the governor and Herod the king.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:5
verses.text: He also died, and rose again, and ascended into the heavens to Him that sent Him, and is sat down at His right hand, and shall come at the end of the world, with His Father's glory, to judge the living and the dead, and to render to every one according to his works.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 11:6
verses.text: He who knows these things with a full assurance, and believes them, is happy; even as ye are now the lovers of God and of Christ, in the full assurance of our hope, from which may no one of us ever be turned aside!.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:1
verses.text: Chapter 12 — Ye are superior to me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:2
verses.text: May I enjoy you in all respects, if indeed I be worthy! For though I am bound, I am not worthy to be compared to any of you that are at liberty.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:3
verses.text: I know that ye are not puffed up, for ye have Jesus Christ in yourselves.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:4
verses.text: And all the more when I commend you, I know that ye cherish modesty of spirit; as it is written, "The righteous man is his own accuser".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:5
verses.text: May I enjoy you in all respects, if indeed I be worthy! For though I am bound, I am not worthy to be compared to one of you that are at liberty.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:6
verses.text: I know that ye are not puffed up, for ye have Jesus in yourselves.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:7
verses.text: And all the more when I commend you, I know that ye cherish modesty of spirit; as it is written, "The righteous man is his own accuser;" and again, "Declare thou first thine iniquities, that thou mayest be justified;" and again, "When ye shall have done all things that are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants;" "for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:8
verses.text: For says the Scripture, "God be merciful to me a sinner".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:9
verses.text: Therefore those great ones, Abraham and Job, styled themselves "dust and ashes before God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:10
verses.text: And David says, "Who am I before Thee, O Lord, that Thou hast glorified me hitherto?" And Moses, who was "the meekest of all men," saith to God, "I am of a feeble voice, and of a slow tongue".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 12:11
verses.text: Be ye therefore also of a humble spirit, that ye may be exalted; for "he that abaseth himself shall be exalted, and he that exalteth himself shall be abased".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 13:1
verses.text: Chapter 13 — Be established in faith and unity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 13:2
verses.text: Study, therefore, to be established in the doctrines of the Lord and the apostles, that so all things, whatsoever ye do, may prosper both in the flesh and spirit; in faith and love; in the Son, and in the Father, and in the Spirit; in the beginning and in the end; with your most admirable bishop, and the well-compacted spiritual crown of your presbytery, and the deacons who are according to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 13:3
verses.text: Be ye subject to the bishop, and to one another, as Jesus Christ to the Father, according to the flesh, and the apostles to Christ, and to the Father, and to the Spirit; that so there may be a union both fleshly and spiritual.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 13:4
verses.text: Study, therefore, to be established in the doctrines of the Lord and the apostles, that so all things, whatsoever ye do, may prosper, both in the flesh and spirit, in faith and love, with your most admirable bishop, and the well-compacted spiritual crown of your presbytery, and the deacons who are according to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 13:5
verses.text: Be ye subject to the bishop, and to one another, as Christ to the Father, that there may be a unity according to God among you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:1
verses.text: Chapter 14 — Your prayers requested.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:2
verses.text: Knowing as I do that ye are full of God, I have but briefly exhorted you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:3
verses.text: Be mindful of me in your prayers, that I may attain to God; and of the Church which is in Syria, whence I am not worthy to derive my name: for I stand in need of your united prayer in God, and your love, that the Church which is in Syria may be deemed worthy of being refreshed by your Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:4
verses.text: Knowing as I do that ye are full of all good, I have but briefly exhorted you in the love of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:5
verses.text: Be mindful of me in your prayers, that I may attain to God; and of the Church which is in Syria, of whom I am not worthy to be called bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 14:6
verses.text: For I stand in need of your united prayer in God, and of your love, that the Church which is in Syria may be deemed worthy, by your good order, of being edified in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:1
verses.text: Chapter 15 — Salutations.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:2
verses.text: The Ephesians from Smyrna (whence I also write to you), who are here for the glory of God, as ye also are, who have in all things refreshed me, salute you, along with Polycarp, the bishop of the Smyrnaeans.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:3
verses.text: The rest of the Churches, in honour of Jesus Christ, also salute you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:4
verses.text: Fare ye well in the harmony of God, ye who have obtained the inseparable Spirit, who is Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:5
verses.text: The Ephesians from Smyrna (whence I also write to you), who are here for the glory of God, as ye also are, who have in all things refreshed me, salute you, as does also Polycarp.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:6
verses.text: The rest of the Churches, in honour of Jesus Christ, also salute you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Megnesians 15:7
verses.text: Fare ye well in harmony, ye who have obtained the inseparable Spirit, in Christ Jesus, by the will of God.
